original: A list of frequently asked  Ansible Interview Questions  and Answers are given below.
result: Here are some commonly asked questions and answers for an interview on Ansible.

original: Ansible is an open-source IT engine that automates application deployment, cloud provisioning, intra service orchestration, and other IT tools.
result: Ansible is a software tool used for automating various IT operations such as cloud provisioning, application deployment, intra-service orchestration, and more. It is a freely available open-source platform that offers IT professionals an effective way to manage their IT infrastructure.

original: Ansible is very easy to deploy because it does not use any  agents  or  custom security  infrastructure on the client-side, and by pushing modules to the clients. These modules are executed locally on the client-side, and the output is pushed back to the Ansible server. It can easily connect to clients using  SSH-Keys .
result: Deploying Ansible is a simple process due to its agentless architecture. It doesn't require any custom security infrastructure on the client-side and operates by sending modules to the clients. These modules are then executed locally on the client-side, and the data is sent back to the Ansible server. Connecting to clients is also straightforward with the use of SSH keys.

original: Ansible is free to use by everyone.
result: Ansible is available to everyone without any cost.

original: Ansible is very consistent and lightweight, and no constraints regarding the operating system or underlying hardware are present.
result: Ansible stands out for its lightness and consistency, allowing for versatile usage regardless of operating systems or hardware.

original: Ansible does not need any special system administrator skills to install and use it.
result: You don't require specialized skills in system administration to install and use Ansible.

original: Ansible has a smooth learning curve determined by the comprehensive documentation and easy to learn structure and configuration.
result: Ansible is easy to learn thanks to its well-documented structure and configuration. As a result, users can quickly pick up the necessary skills and easily maneuver through the platform.

original: Ansible Tower is like Ansible at a more enterprise level. It is the web-based solution for managing your organization with an easy user interface that provides a dashboard with all of the state summaries of all the hosts. And allows quick deployments, and monitors all configurations.
result: Ansible Tower is an elevated version of Ansible, designed for enterprise-level use. It is a web-based platform that offers a user-friendly interface to manage organizational tasks, including a comprehensive dashboard that displays state summaries of all hosts, ensuring efficient deployment and configuration monitoring.

original: Ansible Galaxy is a galaxy website where users can share roles and to a command-line tool for  installing, creating,  and  managing  roles.
result: Ansible Galaxy is a platform where role-sharing is possible. It offers a command-line tool that lets users manage, install, and create roles.

original: Ansible Galaxy gives greater visibility to one of Ansible's most exciting features, such as application installation or reusable roles for server configuration. Lots of people share roles in the Ansible Galaxy.
result: Ansible Galaxy is a platform that enables users to share and explore reusable roles and application installation scripts for server configuration using Ansible. It's a great way to discover exciting features and collaborate with other users in the community. Many people actively contribute and share their roles on Ansible Galaxy.

original: Ansible modules are discrete units of code which can be used from the command line or in a playbook task.
result: Ansible modules are independent pieces of programming that can be utilized in individual command line operations or in tasks within a playbook. They provide specific functionalities and commands that can be used to automate different processes.

original: The modules also referred to as task plugins or library plugins in the Ansible.
result: In Ansible, there are certain components known as modules which can also be referred to as library plugins or task plugins.

original: Ansible ships with several modules that are called  module library , which can be executed directly or remote hosts through the playbook.
result: Ansible comes with a set of modules known as the module library. These modules can be executed remotely on hosts through a playbook or even directly.

original: Users can also write their modules. These modules can control like  services, system resources, files,  or  packages,  etc. and handle executing system commands.
result: It is possible for users to create their own modules that can perform various tasks such as managing system resources, files, packages, and services. These modules can also handle the execution of system commands.

original: Ansible works by connecting to the nodes and pushing out a small program called  Ansible modules  to them. Then Ansible executed these modules and removed them after finished. The library of the modules can reside on any machine, and there are no  daemons, servers,  or  databases  required.
result: Ansible operates by establishing connections to nodes and deploying a lightweight program known as Ansible modules to them. These modules are then executed by Ansible and eliminated upon completion. The modules library can be located on any system, and there is no need for any servers, databases, or daemons.

original: The  Management Node  is the controlling node that controls the entire execution of the playbook. The  inventory  files provide the list of hosts where the Ansible modules need to be run. The  Management Node  makes an  SSH  connection and executes the small modules on the  host's  machine and install the software.
result: The central controlling node in Ansible is known as the Management Node. Its role is to oversee the entire playbook execution process. To determine the target hosts, Ansible uses inventory files. The Management Node creates an SSH connection to each host and runs small modules to install or configure software on that machine.

original: If you are a windows user, then you required to have a virtual machine in which Linux should be installed.
result: In order to use Linux on a Windows system, it is necessary to set up a virtual machine that has Linux installed on it.

original: And it requires python 2.6 version or higher.
result: Python-Conda is a package and environment management system, which helps in managing multiple software packages and their dependencies. It facilitates easy switching between different versions of packages and helps in creating isolated environments for different projects. It is mandatory to have Python version 2.6 or higher to use Conda.

original: The variable is very similar to using the variables in a programming language. It helps you to assign a value to a variable and use it anywhere in the playbook. You can put the conditions around the value of the variables and use them in the playbook accordingly.
result: Variables in Ansible are a powerful feature that allow you to assign values to a variable and use it anywhere in your playbook. You can also add conditional statements around the variable values, allowing for more flexibility in how you use them throughout your playbook. Essentially, variables work much like programming language variables, and are a crucial tool for efficient and effective playbook execution.

original: Ansible Task allows us to break up bits of configuration policy into smaller files. These are the block of code which can be used to automate any process.
result: An Ansible Task serves as a way to divide configuration policy into smaller chunks, which can be automated using code blocks.

result: Ansible Vault is a security feature that enables secure storage of confidential information.
